statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: The SuperSonics won their eighth straight road game, rallying for  a 98-81 victory over the Atlanta Hawks as Rashard Lewis scored 19  points to lead a balanced attack.
article.headline: Payton moves to 14th on NBA career assist list
article.linkText: Sonics storm past Hawks for eighth straight road victory
article.story:
ATLANTA (AP) -- Gary Payton took a step up the NBA's career assists list, and the Seattle SuperSonics continued their drive for the playoffs.
Payton

Payton scored 14 points and had 12 assists, moving past Kevin Johnson into 14th place on the NBA career assist list as the Sonics beat Atlanta 98-81 Wednesday. It may be the defining statistic for point guards, but Payton seemed to care little about it. "I don't pay too much attention to that stuff," said Payton, who has 6,517 assists and trails No. 13 Muggsy Bogues by nine. "I credit my teammates for that. They're knocking down the shots. I just get it to them." The Sonics won their eighth straight away game, equaling the second-longest road winning streak in club history with the win. Seattle finished February at 9-4, its best month of the season. Rashard Lewis scored 19 points for the Sonics, who won 10 straight on the road in 1995. They trailed by 13 in the first quarter but outscored Atlanta 78-50 over the final three periods to win going away. "Two weeks ago, in the fourth quarter and the second half we were awful," said Seattle coach Nate McMillan. "The last several games our defense has picked up." Shareef Abdur-Rahim scored 24 and grabbed 16 rebounds for Atlanta, while Jason Terry scored 18. The Hawks lost for the fourth time in five games. "The first quarter was easy for us," said Abdur-Rahim. "I don't know if we thought it would be like that from then on and then let up. The way we started the second quarter, it just carried on. We were lackadaisical." Atlanta led by as many as 13 in the first quarter, scoring 10 consecutive points midway through the period for a 22-12 advantage. Abdur-Rahim's three-point play gave the Hawks a 27-16 lead. His layup in the final minute of the period pushed it to 31-18. Seattle outscored the Hawks 16-5 over the first six minutes of the second period and took the lead at 45-42 on Lewis' three-point play on a dunk. "I missed a lot of easy shots early," Lewis said. "After I got that dunk I felt a little more confidence in myself." The Sonics led 49-45 at halftime and used a 6-0 spurt midway through the third, increasing the margin to 61-51 on Payton's layup.

Game notes
Lewis has scored in double figures in 50 of Seattle's 58 games ... The Hawks, ranked 20th in the NBA in field goal percentage, shot 42 percent from the floor, the 24th straight game in which they've hit less than 50 percent ... The Hawks finished February 6-6, and have not had a month above .500 since April, 1999.
